text: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: In cooperation with BRAC JAMES P School of Public Health, BRAC University, Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: United Nations Convention On The Rights Of Persons With Disabilities
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: The United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (UNCRPD) is an international human rights treaty of the United Nations intended to protect the rights and dignity of persons with disabilities.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: It aims to ensure that persons with disabilities enjoy the same human rights as everyone else and that they can participate fully in society by receiving the same opportunities as others.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By ratifying the UNCRPD, Bangladesh is committed to promoting and protecting the full enjoyment of human rights by persons with disabilities and ensuring they have full equality under the law.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: The Convention covers a wide range of areas including, education, employment, access to justice, personal security, independent living, and access to information.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Reduce inequality within and among countries
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe resilient and sustainable
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Take urgent action combat climate change and its impacts
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas, and marine resources for sustainable development
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the global partnership for sustainable development.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programs
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 ensure all learners acquire knowledge and skills needed to promote sustainable development, including among others through education for sustainable development and sustainable lifestyles, human rights, gender equality, promotion of a culture of peace and non-violence, global citizenship, and appreciation of cultural diversity and of culture’s contribution to sustainable development
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 eliminate all forms of violence against all woman and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the ICPD and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Good Health And Well-Being: Ensure Healthy Lives And Promote Well-Being For All At All Ages
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health care services, including for family planning, information and education, and the integration of reproductive health into national strategies and programs
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of family planning demand met with modern contraception
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of health facilities that provide essential SRHR services
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of health facilities that provide postpartum, post abortion and/or HIV services that also provide clients who use those services with contraceptive information and care
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of young men and women aged 15-24 with basic knowledge about sexual and reproductive health and rights
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Adolescent birthrate among women aged 10-14, 15-17 and 18-19
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of births to women younger than 20 that were unplanned
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of women using contraceptives who were informed about possible side effects of their method and how to deal with them
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: An indicator reflective of respectful care and human rights in provision of SRH information and services
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Country includes HPV vaccination in its vaccination program
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of health facilities that provide care for complications related to unsafe abortion or where it is not against the law, that provide safe abortion
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: This is underpinned by the right to life (CRPD article 10)
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Access to sexual and reproductive health services is recognized by the right to enjoyment of the highest attainable standard of health without discrimination on the basis of disability (CRPD article 25)
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Family planning, information and education is ensured by respect for home and the family (CRPD article 23), as well as articles 6, 7, 9, 11, 31 and 32
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Quality Education: Ensure Inclusive And Equitable Quality Education And Promote Lifelong Learning Opportunities For All
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 ensure all learners acquire knowledge and skills needed to promote sustainable development, including among others through education for sustainable development and sustainable lifestyles, human rights, gender equality, promotion of a culture of peace and non-violence, global citizenship, and appreciation of cultural diversity and of culture’s contribution to sustainable development
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of schools that serve students in the age range of 12.17 years in which comprehensive sexuality education is available
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Article 24 of the CRPD promotes an inclusive education system at all levels on the basis of equal opportunity and freedom from exclusion
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Persons with disabilities must have effective access to general technical and vocational guidance programmes, placement services and vocational and continuing training as outlined in article 27 of the CRPD
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Safe, non-violent learning environments can be enabled by protection from exploitation, violence and abuse outside the home in article 16 of the CRPD, in addition articles 5, 6, 7, 9, 31 and 32 apply
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Gender Equality: Achieve Gender Equality And Empower All Women And Girls
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the ICPD and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of women aged 15-49 years who make their own informed decisions regarding sexual relations, contraceptive use and reproductive health care
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Whether universal access to contraceptive and SRH information and services is included in national policy
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of ever-partnered women and girls aged 15 years and older subjected to physical, sexual or psychological violence by a current or former intimate partner in the previous 12 months, by form of violence and by age
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of women and girls aged 15 years and older subjected to sexual violence by persons other than an intimate partner in the previous 12 months, by age and place o9f occurrence
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: By 2030 eliminate all harmful practices, such as child, early and forced marriage and female genital mutilation
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of women aged 20-24 years who were married of in a union before age 15 and before age 18
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Proportion of girls and women aged 15-49 years who have undergone female genital mutilation/cutting, by age
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Article 6 of the CRPD recognizes that women and girls with disabilities are subjected to multiple discrimination; the elimination of harmful practices requires effective women-and child-focused legislation and policies as outlined in article 16 of the CRPD
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: The provision of social protection policies is covered by article 28 of the CRPD
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: The right to participation in political and public life relates to article 29 of the CRPD; the right to the same range and quality and standard of free or affordable sexual and reproductive health is recognized in article 25 of the CRPD
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: The right to reproductive and family planning is ensured through respect for home and family (CRPD article 23)
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Women’s right to ownership over land, property and inheritance is acknowledged in CRPD article 12’s right to equal recognition before the law
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: And the right to accessible information and communications for women and girls is outlined in article 21 of the CRPD
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: The promotion of gender equality for women and girls with disabilities is recognized in article 8 of the CRPD on awareness-raising, in addition articles 5, 7, 9 and 31 are applicable
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Achieving 17 Global Goals will leave no one behind
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Our Nationwide Research on SRHR of Persons With Disabilities

Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Primary research among persons with disabilities to explore their SRHR needs, knowledge about SRHR, SRH sufferings and SRH service utilization
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Mapping of existing interventions and services relevant to SRHR of persons with disabilities in Bangladesh, identify gaps/limitations in the existing interventions and services and recommend strategies to improve delivery of efficacious interventions/services
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Exploring the policy approaches to promote SRHR of persons with disabilities in Bangladesh, identify gaps/limitations (it there is any) in the existing laws, policies and action plans, and recommend strategies to fill the gaps

text: Adolescents with disabilities have been identified as a ~special vulnerable group” under this Strategy
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: The focus areas of the Strategy relate to SDG 3 (3.1, 3.2, 3.4, 3.7, 3.8), SDG 5 (5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5b) and SDG 2 (2.1, 2.2), and the Strategy can also contribute to achieving commitments under UNCRPD Article 25 (Health), it programs and activities carried out under the Strategy include and focus on adolescents with disabilities
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Bangladesh has also ratified the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW) and also has commitments under the Fourth World Conference on Women (Beijing Conference, 1995), which specifically mentions SRHR needs of women.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: If Bangladesh can work towards achieving these in an inclusive manner, it would also contribute positively to SDG 3, 5 as well as UNCRPD Articles 5, 6, 7, 12, 13, 15.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: DGHS has issued a circular in 2018 regarding making services at government health facilities inclusive to persons with disabilities.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: If this is properly circulated to all healthcare centers and implemented, it can contribute to achieve SDG 3, as well as commitments under UNCRPD Articles 9, 19, 20, 25
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Jatiyo Protibondhi Unnayan Foundation runs Protibondhi Seba o Sahajya Kendro (disability service centres) in all 64 districts, and operates 32 mobile therapy vans which provide healthcare services (including maternity services) to women with disabilities in remote and rural areas in the country
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Article 31 of the UNCRPD commits State parties to collect statistics and data that are necessary to put the other commitments under the Convention into effect.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: As a signatory, since Bangladesh has a commitment to do so, it can be recommended that information be collected strategically in a way that is consistent with SDG’s
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD
Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: More focus should be given towards ensuring the standard AAAQ (accessibility, availability, acceptability and quality) framework while delivering services and interventions related to SRHR of persons with disabilities
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Age appropriate comprehensive sexuality education should be taught in all special schools and in technical and vocational training institutes in the country
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Government should focus on reducing social stigma and misconception around SRHR of persons with disabilities
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare may take the initiative of providing free sanitary napkins to adolescent girls with disabilities in urban and rural areas
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: More awareness programs are required to prevent violence against persons with disabilities, especially the emotional abuse faced by persons with developmental disabilities
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Institutional responses of different government departments need to be strengthened to address any kind of discrimination and abuse against persons with disabilities
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Appropriate interventions and plans are required for providing legal support to the sexually assaulted victims.
filetitle: Current Situation Of SRHR Of Persons With Disabilities In Bangladesh In The Context Of SDGs And UNCRPD

text: Capacity building of different official (such as, health care providers, police personnel and practicing lawyers) should be considered a priority
